_items.title: Exhibition
_items.body: A type of event where attendees can explore and learn about products on display.

_items.title: Exposition
_items.body: An event that focuses on the display and/or demonstration of products or services for various industries. Exposition events are designed to provide attendees with an overview and showcase of the products and services available in the marketplace, and to connect buyers with the companies that offer them.

_items.title: Logistics
_items.body: The things that must be done to plan and organise a complicated activity or event that involves many people.

_items.title: Socio-economic
_items.body: An economic and sociological combined total measure of a person’s work experience and of an individual’s or family’s economic and social position in relation to others, based on income, education and occupation.

_items.title: Sole trader
_items.body: A person who is the exclusive owner of a business, entitled to keep all profits after tax has been paid, but liable for all losses.

_items.title: Positive duty
_items.body: Requires all organisations covered by the law – including government, business, employers and service providers – to take reasonable and proportionate measures to eliminate discrimination, sexual harassment and victimisation. In December 2022, positive duty was extended, making employers take more active measures to prevent workplace sexual harassment and discrimination, rather than just responding only after it occurs.

_items.title: Common law
_items.body: Laws or legal principles that have been established by courts over the years. Also known as case law or precedent.

_items.title: Intellectual property
_items.body: Creations of the mind such as designs, inventions or artistic work.

_items.title: Sustainable
_items.body: The quality of not being harmful to the environment or depleting natural resources and thereby supporting long-term ecological balance.

_items.title: Flora
_items.body: The plants of a particular region or habitat.

_items.title: Morality
_items.body: Principles concerning the distinction between right and wrong or good and bad behaviour.

_items.title: Inclusive
_items.body: An environment where members or employees feel respected and connected to each other.

_items.title: Shareholder
_items.body: In publicly listed companies (those listed on the stock exchange), shareholders are those who own a share of stock.

_items.title: Labour turnover
_items.body: Employee or labour turnover is the rate at which a company gains and loses employees.

_items.title: Stereotype
_items.body: To place people in categories according to things they have in common and assume everyone in this category is the same.

_items.title: Stakeholder
_items.body: An organisation, person or entity that has an interest or concern in your company. This can include, but is not limited to, employees, customers, suppliers, the local community, unions and shareholders.

_items.title: Discrimination
_items.body: The act of disadvantaging or treating someone unfairly because of a group or category to which that person belongs, or is perceived to belong to

_items.title: Culture
_items.body: Shared values, beliefs, knowledge and rituals shared by a particular society or group.

_items.title: Duty of care
_items.body: Your legal responsibility to take reasonable care to ensure that your actions don’t cause harm to others.

_items.title: Remuneration
_items.body: Pay and other benefits of monetary value such as company car, mobile phone, additional leave and incentives.

_items.title: Affirmative action
_items.body: Positive steps towards demonstrating EEO. Often involves programs to help traditionally disadvantaged groups.

_items.title: Bias
_items.body: A viewpoint that refuses to consider other possible thoughts or opinions. Prejudicial thought.

_items.title: Recruitment
_items.body: This is the process of finding or attracting candidates for a position.

_items.title: Selection
_items.body: This is the process of choosing the best candidate for the position.

_items.title: Victimise
_items.body: The process of singling out someone for unjust treatment and punishment.

_items.title: Adverse action
_items.body: Harmful unlawful actions taken against an employee or prospective employee.

_items.title: Union
_items.body: A membership organisation that represents the rights of workers in employment or industrial relations issues.

_items.title: Grievance
_items.body: The term used to describe an employee complaint. Workplaces should have a clear grievance procedure in place.

_items.title: Prejudice
_items.body: A preconceived idea or opinion that is not based upon facts or reason. This often leads to unfair, harmful treatment.

_items.title: Flexitime
_items.body: A variable work schedule consisting of core hours that employees must attend, for example, between 10 am and 3 pm, and the rest of the hours are worked at times the employee chooses.

_items.title: Secondment
_items.body: Temporary international or interstate placement within the company.

_items.title: Gonadal
_items.body: Gonads are the part of the body that produces gametes, or reproductive cells. In women it’s the ovaries and in men it’s the testes.
